data.title: Rename "disconnect" button for the singleplayer lobby and hook it to esc hotkey
Air-strike should only reveal target area
data.body: Currently the entire path that the A-10s take is explored as they pass over it. This makes it really easy to scout large parts of the map unintentionally. It would make more sense if only the targeted area is explored. This also mirrors their behaviour in the original C&C.

data.title: Flood fill in editor (shift+click) doesn't treat similar grass/snow/desert tiles as the same
data.body: Because terrain pieces are now randomized when maps are created, flood fill isn't usable.

data.title: Changed things to do with Shroud to WRange. Updated Utility.
data.body: Closes #4679

data.title: EjectOnDeath pilot improvements
data.body:
I think EjectOnDeath can be improved a bit & looking for discussion on how to approach this.

Right now:
- Ejects a predefined `PilotActor` (E1) from a downed aircraft or tank (depending on the mod).

It doesn't properly handle:
- Mechanics - if a husk is repaired by a mechanic, the tank still has a chance to eject an E1 when destroyed. The unit's driver is actually the mechanic, and maybe it should eject them on death, or not at all.
- Hijackers - if a unit becomes hijacked the original driver is technically dead - this is the same situation as a Mechanic, an E1 may still be ejected.

We could pull `PilotActor` out of `EjectOnDeath` and make a separate `Driver` trait. When the unit is captured or hijacked then the driver/actor reference would be updated. This also ties in a bit to renegade-style gameplay, or sniping drivers out of vehicles (Generals/Jarmen Kell).

Or we could somehow make Cargo support driver units as well (this might be the cleanest).

Pchote also mentioned showing art/badges on units with a different driver, so you know what can eject.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1421642-ejectondeath-pilot-improvements?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: No precautions taken to ensure MCV may be deployed at the start of game.
data.body: In my last game vs rider, I could not deploy because there was a pesky little crate in my MCV's build area, and the infantry took a while to pick it up. Needless to say, after losing a few seconds, I was quickly overwhelmed and lost the game.

data.title: Prevent UI sounds from 'overlapping'
data.body:
Currently, if you click on a UI button repeatedly, like when building multiple units, the sample for that action is played as many times as the button is clicked. This is pretty crude and a better way to handle that scenario should be implemented.

My suggestion would be that only 1 of each UI sample may be played at the same time. Don't playback the sample if it's already playing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1421556-prevent-ui-sounds-from-overlapping?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added two new Sound settings for Tick sounds.
data.body:
Separates the tick sound option into two, one for playing income ticks and one for playing spending ticks.
The constant ticking sound is quite annoying, and is something that is always mentioned when I show this game to friends. So I made this compromise, so that people can still hear when they get more money, but don't have to hear the ticks constantly.
I made my best guess on how to implement this visually in the settings GUI. Feel free to discuss my choice.

data.title: parabombs
data.body:
As discussed in channel, Parabombers no longer lay smoke before bombing 
they do not reveal shroud (probably not a bug) but still reveals newly built buildings.

Hard to repro as it will take a load of crates to catch

data.title: D2K Infantry Death Scream Volume
data.body: with OpenD2K at least, all the infantry death sounds can be heard at maximum volume no matter where your screen is centered - there could be hundreds of soldiers shooting each other on the other side of the map, and you'll hear the gun shots accordingly softer, but when they die their screams are heard at full volume as if they were present within your current view.

data.title: AI always build in very small Water Places
data.body:
The AI build very often in an very small Area with water an shipyard and lots of Boats.
but the cant move anythere.

So here my solution on this:

1.AI dont build shipyards when there are other Strand/land sprites are very near the place where the AI CAN build the Shipyard.

2.The Game engine can mark the water. (invinsibile)
when the AI has detect more than 256 blocks of water (the ai has seen water without "fog of war" ) than the AI build an shipyard.

3.The AI dont build any ships when the ships itself has no room any more to move on.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1413741-ai-always-build-in-very-small-water-places?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

Go to the "Options",than to "Input" and than activate "Left Click Orders" 
When you play an Match sometimes your Orders to your Units has no Effect it is in 25% of the time totally random.

data.title: Fix selection persistence for invisible units
data.body:
FogObscures might need to be renamed, since it can potentially check more (and does check more: cloaking) than just fog visibility.

This patch should deselect units that enter the fog or activate their cloak, and also not count towards their control group (so no viewport jumping to their location) when in this state.

data.title: First-come, first-served admin is silly.
data.body:
To change maps, a voting system would be much more appropriate. A few buggers went around and hijacked one of the public dedicated servers.

data.title: included a spectator toggle in the server admin dropdown
data.body:
I have added into LobbyWidgets an action to the server admin dropdown where it acts as a toggle. 

![spectators_1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2963387/2179004/cd1bb342-9687-11e3-900c-41baae5f236f.jpg)

when it is toggled (default) the game allows spectators as normal. when not toggled, all current spectators are kicked and the add spectator button dissapears.

![spectators_2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2963387/2179006/ff2c13e0-9687-11e3-97ca-6d36bf27f7b5.jpg)

The exception however is the admin, who can still be a spectator at this point (if he was already when it was toggled). Figured it might be good if the admin still could.

Let me know what you guys think, its not in CnC yet as I would like your opinion on placement, logic etc.
